text: TEMPLE COLLEGE	Name: ____________________________________ Vocational Nursing Program VNSG 1260: Clinical LVN Training I Clinical Evaluation Tool Using the Rating Scale for Clinical Performance, rate student performance using a “0”, “1”, “2”, or “3”. Cite specific care examples to support your ratings whenever possible. Use the definitions on the rating scale. Critical elements are those performance expectations which are marked with a (*). These behaviors are those which may stand alone as evaluation criteria. If a student receives a zero on an asterisked item on their final evaluation, they will fail VNSG 1260: Clinical-LVN Training I. Student Instructor Grade Comments Grade Comments I. PROVIDER OF PATIENT CENTERED CARE 1. Assessment/Diagnosis A. Apply structured data collection tools for assessment of patient B. Identify a variety of factors, including spiritual & cultural beliefs, affecting the patient's health C. Identify NANDA diagnoses related to patient problems/needs with instructor assistance 2. Goals/Plan for Care A. Identify predictable and basic health needs of patients B. Recognize abnormal patient findings C. Monitor and report any changes in the patient’s condition D. Demonstrate basic knowledge of disease prevention and health promotion E. Identify interventions to promote health and rehabilitation 3. Implementation *A. Performs within the identified scope of practice B. Meets patient’s nutritional needs C. Provides hygiene/elimination needs D. Monitors and reports changes in patient’s skin assessment *E. Maintains patient safety while providing mobility needs F. Monitors and reports vital sign values G. Identify therapeutic communication techniques 4. Teaching-Learning A. Identify patient teaching-learning needs 5. Clinical data/current literature A. Written work reflects knowledge base and patient data B. Written work is prepared according to standards II. MEMBER OF THE HEALTH CARE TEAM 1. Collaboration with patients and health care team members A. Identify health care team member’s roles in the holistic plan of care B. Communicate and collaborate in a timely manner with members of the interdisciplinary health care team C. Demonstrates effective communication with instructor III. MEMBER OF THE PROFESSION 1. Accountability & Responsibility A. Demonstrate clinical preparedness B. Adhere to rules of V.N Department, College and clinical agency C. Follows dress code D. Seeks out new learning opportunities *E. Adapt behavior in response to instructor feedback *F. Demonstrates respect for patient, instructors, peers & staff G. Describe behaviors of professional nursing practice on the Self-Evaluation report H. Participate in clinical conferences *I. Maintain patient confidentiality and privacy J. Demonstrates effective time management IV. PATIENT SAFETY ADVOCATE *A. Promote safe, effective environment for self and others B. Follow CDC guidelines for Standard Precautions TOTALS TEMPLE COLLEGE Vocational Nursing Program VNSG 1260: Clinical LVN Training I 	Name: ____________________________________ Clinical Evaluation Tool Scale average Percentage Grade STUDENT Comments and Signature STUDENT Signature and Title INSTRUCTOR Signature and Title
